private_information: I specialize in converting natural language action descriptions into machine-readable action schemas.
I preserve exact predicate names and argument structures as given.
I avoid inventing types or predicates that are not explicitly stated.
action_modeler.goal: Produce a precise, compact action model from the public information that other agents can use to build and validate planning instances.

private_information: I extract and normalize initial states, goals, and object sets for each scenario.
I ensure object identifiers are consistent across scenarios and match the action model.
I do not change or infer facts that are not explicitly stated.
state_curator.goal: Provide normalized object lists and initial/goal facts for each scenario A and B that are consistent with the action model.

private_information: I validate sequential plans against preconditions and effects.
I detect the earliest failing step (if any) and explain why.
I propose lightweight hints without generating formal PDDL.
plan_digest.goal: Assess the given plan for Scenario A, report validity and any failure point, and suggest adjustments or heuristics that may help for Scenario B.

private_information: I integrate the action model and curated scenarios to produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem files suitable for the FastDownward solver.
I keep the domain STRIPS-compatible with positive preconditions and add/delete effects.
I ensure all facts and objects match the provided specifications.
orchestrator.goal: Generate a single PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (Scenario A and Scenario B) that solve the described tasks using FastDownward.

public_information: Objects available (as constants): object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3, object_4, object_5, object_6, object_7, object_8, object_9, object_10, object_11.
Actions catalogue: paltry(x,y,z); sip(x,y,z); clip(x,y,z); wretched(a,b,c,d); memory(x,y,z); tightfisted(x,y,z).
paltry pre: hand x, cats y, texture z, vase x y, next y z; effects add: next x z; effects del: vase x y.
sip pre: hand x, cats y, texture z, next x z, next y z; effects add: vase x y; effects del: next x z.
clip pre: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, next x z; effects add: vase x y; effects del: next x z.
wretched pre: sneeze a, texture b, texture c, stupendous d, next a b, collect b d, collect c d; effects add: next a c; effects del: next a b.
memory pre: cats x, spring y, spring z, next x y; effects add: next x z; effects del: next x y.
tightfisted pre: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, vase x y; effects add: next x z; effects del: vase x y.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_3 object_7, next object_4 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario A goal: next object_11 object_10.

Scenario A provided plan (sequential): wretched object_3 object_7 object_6 object_1; clip object_11 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; tightfisted object_11 object_3 object_5; memory object_0 object_8 object_5; sip object_11 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_8; paltry object_11 object_0 object_8; clip object_11 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_10 object_2; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_10.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, next object_0 object_5, next object_11 object_8, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario B goal: next object_11 object_9.

specify.system_prompt: You are an expert in formal action modeling for classical planning. Transform the public information into a compact action model that preserves exact predicate and action names without inventing new types or predicates.
specify.prompt: Your name is action_modeler. Using the following public information: {environment->public_information} and your knowledge: {agents->action_modeler->private_information}, extract a machine-readable action model. Return a single JSON object with key actions, where each action is an object with fields name, parameters (use variables ?a ?b ?c ?d), preconditions (list of predicate templates), add_effects (list), del_effects (list). Do not output PDDL or any other format; keep the output concise and faithful to the specification.

extract.system_prompt: You are skilled at normalizing planning instances by listing objects, initial facts, and goal facts per scenario.
extract.prompt: Your name is state_curator. From the following public information: {environment->public_information} and your knowledge: {agents->state_curator->private_information}, extract two scenarios named A and B. For each, return objects (the full set of constants), init (list of facts), goal (single fact), and provided_plan (list of action strings if available). Ensure object names and facts match exactly those in the public information. Do not output PDDL.

validate.system_prompt: You validate sequential plans against an action model, identifying the earliest failing step and reasons.
validate.prompt: Your name is plan_digest. You will receive the action model: {action_specs} and the curated instances: {instances}. Validate the Scenario A provided plan step by step using the preconditions and effects. Report whether it reaches the goal; if not, give the first failing step with the unmet preconditions. Provide one or two high-level suggestions for Scenario B (no formal plan required). Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward solver. You produce a single STRIPS-compatible domain and problem files that faithfully encode the provided actions, objects, initial states, and goals. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and each pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the action model and scenarios to produce the final planning artifacts for FastDownward. Requirements: (1) Produce one domain named odl19 with :requirements :strips only; predicates: hand ?x, cats ?x, texture ?x, vase ?x ?y, next ?x ?y, sneeze ?x, spring ?x, stupendous ?x, collect ?x ?y. (2) Encode exactly these actions with the stated preconditions and add/delete effects: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. (3) Use constants object_0 ... object_11. (4) Emit two problem files using the same domain: scenario_a (with Scenario A init and goal) and scenario_b (with Scenario B init and goal). (5) Optionally include the Scenario A provided plan as PDDL comments using semicolons inside the problem file. Output format: one <domain>...</domain> block followed by two <problem>...</problem> blocks, and nothing else.
